intro: Aspidocarya pentaneura, commonly known as the narrow-veined rock fern, is a member of the family Polypodiaceae. It is a small, terrestrial fern that typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rocky crevices and forest floors. The plant has delicate, lanceolate leaves with a distinctive pattern of five prominent veins. Its rhizomes are short and often covered in a layer of fine, root-like structures. Aspidocarya pentaneura is characterized by its simple, non-branching fronds and is found primarily in temperate regions of the Southern Hemisphere.
